means: 禁止某人做某事（或去某处等）

sentence.Network_en: A number of governments banned the ship from their territorial waters.
sentence.Network_cn: 许多国家都禁止那艘船进入其领海。

sentence.Network_en: Smoking is now banned in many places of work.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在许多工作场所禁止吸烟。

sentence.Network_en: The book was banned in the US, as were two subsequent books.
sentence.Network_cn: 这本书在美国遭禁，随后出版的两本也是一样。

PerfectNetExp.abs: i not aware that you may get banned digging your own post ., 我不知道 , 你可能会被禁止挖掘自己的职位.
posting on behalf of a banned member ., 替被禁言的会员发帖规则.

justice Kwan said the splitting of shares was not banned in Hong Kong and there was no evidence that investors voted for anything other than their wish to take profits .关淑馨表示，分拆股票的做法在香港并没有明文禁止，而且没有证据表明投资者在投票时除了希望获利外还有其他目的。
Police still discovered a few banned weapons and ammo ., 警方还发现了一些违禁武器和弹药.

entry.def: To ban something means to state officially that it must not be done, shown, or used.

example.ex: Canada will ban smoking in all offices later this year.
example.tran: 加拿大将从今年晚些时候起在办公场所全面禁烟。

example.ex: Last year arms sales were banned.

entry.def: A ban is an official ruling that something must not be done, shown, or used.

example.ex: The General also lifted a ban on political parties.
example.tran: 将军同时取消了对政党的禁令。

entry.def: If you are banned from doing something, you are officially prevented from doing it.

example.ex: He was banned from driving for three years.

auth_sentence.content: It is about time that gun ownership is banned.

auth_sentence.content: This is the second time India banned cotton exports.

auth_sentence.content: First, women were banned from mosques in Tajikistan.
auth_sentence.res_content: First, women were banned from mosques in Tajikistan.
